params.question: When performing a standard business bow (o-jigi), what is the correct position for your hands?

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Be careful with that choice. Clocks, sharp items, and things in sets of four can have negative or unlucky connotations in Japan. A modest gift from your home country is usually the safest and most thoughtful option.

Be careful with that choice. Clocks, sharp items, and things in sets of four can have negative or unlucky connotations in Japan. A modest gift from your home country is usually the safest and most thoughtful option.

answers.text: A set of four beautifully crafted tea cups.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Excellent choice! A high-quality item from your home country, like Australian wine, is a thoughtful and culturally appropriate gift.

answers.text: A high-quality, beautifully wrapped bottle of Australian wine.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Be careful with that choice. Clocks, sharp items, and things in sets of four can have negative or unlucky connotations in Japan. A modest gift from your home country is usually the safest and most thoughtful option.

answers.text: A set of very sharp, high-end steak knives.

params.question: You want to give a thoughtful gift to a Japanese business partner. Which of the following would be the most appropriate choice?

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That's a common misstep. The most respectful action is to place the card on the table in front of you. This keeps their identity 'present' and shows continuous respect.

answers.text: Immediately put it in your wallet or back pocket.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Perfect! Placing the card respectfully on the table shows you value the person's identity throughout the entire meeting.

answers.text: Place it respectfully on the table in front of you for the duration of the meeting.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That's a common misstep. The most respectful action is to place the card on the table in front of you. This keeps their identity 'present' and shows continuous respect.

answers.text: Quickly glance at it and then use it to take notes.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That's a common misstep. The most respectful action is to place the card on the table in front of you. This keeps their identity 'present' and shows continuous respect.

answers.text: Hand it back to them at the end of the meeting.
